measure.name: add_heat_recovery_chiller
measure.description: This measure adds a heat recovery chiller and heat recovery loop to the model. The heat recovery chiller may be an existing chiller or new stand-alone heat recovery chiller. Converting an existing chiller will allow the chiller to rejected heat to the heat recovery loop in addition to the condenser loop. A new chiller will reject heat only to the heat recovery loop. The user may specify how to connect the heat recovery loop to the hot water loop, whether the heat recovery is in series or parallel with existing heating source objects, and optionally decide whether to adjust hot water loop temperatures and add output variables. The measure DOES NOT size the heat recovery chiller or heat recovery storage objects.
measure.modeler_description: This creates a new heat recovery loop that is attached to a tertiary node to an existing chiller or a new chiller. The heat recovery loop consists of the chiller and a water heater mixed object that is also connected to a hot water loop. The heat recovery loop and hot water loop are sized to the same user defined temperature setpoint as well as all hot water coils in the model.

argument.name: cooling_loop_name
argument.description: Choose the source loop for the heat recovery chiller. Infer From Model will use the chilled water loop by floor area served.

argument.name: heating_loop_name
argument.description: Choose the receipient loop for the heat recovery chiller. Infer From Model will use the largest hot water loop by floor area served.
argument.default_value: Inferred Hot Water Loop From Model

choice.value: Inferred Hot Water Loop From Model
choice.display_name: Inferred Hot Water Loop From Model

choice.value: Inferred Service Hot Water Loop From Model
choice.display_name: Inferred Service Hot Water Loop From Model

argument.name: chiller_choice
argument.display_name: Add new heat recovery chiller or use existing chiller?
argument.description: The default is to add a new heat recovery chiller, otherwise the user will need to select an existing chiller.

argument.name: new_chiller_size_tons
argument.display_name: New heat recovery chiller size in tons cooling
argument.description: Only applicable if add_new_chiller is set to true.

argument.name: existing_chiller_name
argument.description: Only applicable if converting an existing chiller. Choose a chiller to convert to a heat recovery chiller. Infer from model will default to the first chiller on the selected chilled water loop.

argument.name: link_option
argument.display_name: Heat recovery loop to hot water loop connection
argument.description: Choose whether to connect the heat recovery loop to the hot water loop directly, or including a storage tank.

argument.name: storage_tank_size_gal
argument.display_name: Heat recovery storage tank size in gallons
argument.description: Only applicable if using a storage tank.

argument.name: heating_order
argument.display_name: Hot water loop heat recovery ordering
argument.description: Choose whether the heat recovery connection is in parallel or series with the existing hot water source object (boiler, heat pump, district heat, etc.).

argument.name: heat_recovery_loop_temperature_f
argument.display_name: The heat recovery loop temperature in degrees F

argument.name: reset_hot_water_loop_temperature
argument.description: If true, the measure will reset the hot water loop temperature to match the heat recovery loop temperature. It WILL NOT reset demand side coil objects, which could cause simulation errors or unmet hours. If the hot water loop is connected to the heat recovery loop by a heat exchanger instead of a storage tank, the hot water loop temperature will instead be reset to the heat recovery loop temperature minus 5F.

argument.name: reset_heating_coil_design_temp
argument.description: If true, the measure will reset the heating coil design temperatures to match the heat recovery loop temperature.
